channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5261] Jetty JMX configuration needs to be updated for Jetty9
item.description:
See ENTESB-5013 for more details. Because of changes for Jetty9 the Server and Application tabs on the Jetty page don't show any data. When I run the Fuse 6.3 045 build, I only see a subset of the mbeans that I get if I deploy hawtio in a standalone jetty9 server.

Also when I start jboss-fuse-6.3.0.redhat-045 I get 50-60 NPEs like the one below in the log:

10:37:31,656 | WARN | pache.cxf.osgi]) | MBeanContainer | 96 - org.eclipse.jetty.util - 9.2.14.v20151106 | bean: org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.JettyServerWrapper@558bae1a

item.summary: Jetty JMX configuration needs to be updated for Jetty9

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Oh, I've done these commits on Hawtio today being totally unconscious of this JIRA:
https://github.com/hawtio/hawtio/commit/7b4a3024193affa6097a8c4a3d97d33ff4327337
https://github.com/hawtio/hawtio/commit/07023c903ffa2dfd76b636dbab8508bfbb320569
https://github.com/hawtio/hawtio/commit/95f942cb03a613afb2f41be95b40b4f3b062bfab

So, let me take care of this JIRA hereafter.
Pax-Web upgrade ENTESB-5639 is required to make this fix work.

Fix committed to 6.3:
https://github.com/jboss-fuse/hawtio/pull/223

Now 'Applications' page works fine, but 'Server' page still needs Pax-Web upgrade ENTESB-5639 in order for this page to really work; when we have more than one connectors due to ENTESB-5639 'Server' page still fails to work. Keeping it open.

It must be resolved by pax-web upgrade to 4.2.8 (thanks Jonathan Anstey!):

  • https://github.com/jboss-fuse/karaf/commit/2935ee839e1aa89e91846e77d41107d9d8abe66f
  • https://github.com/jboss-fuse/fabric8/commit/8e53952ecb9dd91db58e7b273b598bda196195be
Hi Tadayoshi Sato, could you please explain what should I check to be sure the fix is working? Thanks.

@mastepan You just need to go to the root perspective, then the Jetty tab, and check each of the 4 sub-tabs (Servers, Applications, Connectors, Thread Pools). When I originally logged this nothing was showing up under servers or applications> This looks correct to me now with the 6.3 175 build but I'll let you confirm.
Thanks Kevin. I can confirm there are no blank tabs anymore in 6.3 175.
